revised_title: An Unusual Meiosis Type in Callimantis Antillarum Mantid
tldr: The author discovered a unique meiosis process in the mantid species Callimantis antillarum, where no chiasmata are formed during meiosis, leading to a reductional first meiotic division for all chromosome parts. This is similar to the male Drosophila, but with different underlying mechanisms. The mantid has a simple XO sex determination in males, which is different from other mantids previously studied.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Genetics and Genomics
